alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Ellis (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:31PM CDT until June 22 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN ELLIS...CENTRAL ROGER MILLS...NORTHWESTERN CUSTER AND SOUTHWESTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Shattuck to 9 miles northeast of Crawford to 6 miles northeast of Reydon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hammon, Leedey, Strong City, Moorewood, Crawford, Roll, and Angora. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
